title: Passcode
body:
BTS au one-shot

Jin x Reader Y/N

Fluff

Word Count: 1,078

A/N: Because this situation was too funny not to write about.

You watch from where you stand on the street as a man, face shadowed by the brim of his black snapback, stands on the porch to his house, pleading with a camera crew. The whole situation is intriguing and you find yourself inching closer to try and hear what’s going on.

“I forgot the passcode,” he slurs—ah, he speaks Korean!—and cocks his head to the side. “Please tell me the passcode.”

None of the camera crew respond, keeping their equipment trained on him. He lets out a sigh and his head falls back so he’s looking at the night sky. “Please help me,” he whines.

“You’ve forgotten the passcode to get into your house,” one of the crew finally says. “And you failed to bring your key with you when you decided to go out drinking. You can enter again only if one of the other members comes out.”

“Wah! You’re joking!” the man cries. “I have to sleep out here? Will one of you stay with me at least?” The crew is already beginning to pack up their equipment. “Don’t I get a camera man?”

“You have your own camera and selfie stick. This will make for good behind cam footage.”

“You’re serious, aren’t you?”

“Goodnight, Seokjin.”

Seokjin? As in Kim Seokjin? AS IN BTS SEOKJIN?? HERE? IN MALTA??

“Holy crap,” you utter pressing your back against the wall. You knew this was the time of year they usually filmed their Bon Voyage but you had no idea that when you booked your trip they would be here too. And staying only a block away from your own hostel no less.

You stand frozen in shock, hand gripping the slippery cup containing the chilly remnants of a blue slushy, watching as the crew finishes packing up. Jin, leaning on the half-wall of the porch is also watching, his mouth the only thing not plunged into shadow, is turned down in a pout. Any time a member of the crew gets close to the wall, he utters something down to them but they just ignore him. At last, he’s left alone, the hour late and the street empty. Aside from you of course.

With a heavy sigh, Jin trudges down a few steps and plops down on his bottom, resting his elbows on his knees and his cheeks in his hands.

“This sucks,” he grumbles but quickly perks up when he suddenly notices you. “Wah! What are you doing?”

You’ve been in a daze ever since realizing who it was and even now you feel a bit dizzy, your tongue a bit thick, your hand a bit numb from clutching your cold drink for so long.

“Well? Are you gonna say something?”

“Uhhh.” Good one.

“Well, at least come sit by me so you aren’t lurking like a serial killer.”

At last, you step out of the shadows, nervously making your way over to the oldest member of your absolute favorite music group in the world. You stand in front of him, still holding your blue slushy. Why are you still holding this thing? You got it hours ago.

“What’s your name?” he asks, tilting his face up so it finally catches the light.

Holy crap, he’s beautiful. “Uhhh,” you say again, “Y/N.”

He holds out his hand for you to shake, “I’m Jin.”

Holy crap his hands are soft. Holy crap.

“Want to sit?”

Your head moves up and down in a jerky nod that makes it look like you’re having an aneurysm before you sit down on the step next to him. It’s then that you smell the alcohol on his breath

“I think I made the directors angry,” he says nudging your shoulder with his. “I went out by myself to a bar while the others were filming. I think this is their way of getting me back.”

“It sounds to me like you’re the one that got yourself locked out of your house,” you say.

Jin pulls back sharply. “Hey! Who’s side are you on?”

“Yours!” you yell in a panic. “I don’t know why I said that! I’m so sorry! No, I’m on your side!”

You continue apologizing even as a smile spreads across Jin’s face and his shoulders start to shake from his silent laughter. “Y/N,” he finally says. “It’s okay, I was just joking.”

You feel relief flood your body as you begin to nervously laugh with him.

“Jin-hyung?”

The two of you turn to find Park Jimin propping the door open, rubbing his eyes sleepily. A Chimmy sleeping mask is pushed up on his forehead making his hair stick out every which way.

“Our director called and asked me to come down and let you in.” With one eye still closed, he sets the other one on you. “Oh. Hello,” he cracks.

You practically choke as you give a small wave back at your bias wrecker. Even half-asleep and bedraggled he looks perfect.

“Uh…thanks, Jimin,” Jin says and glances at you. “I think I’m okay, though.”

Jimin’s forehead creases as he furrows his brow and sticks out his lips in a confused pout. “Really?”

“Yeah, go back to bed.”

With a sleepy moan, the maknae shuffles back inside, pulling the door closed behind him, essentially locking the older one out…again.

You turn to look at him, a smile tugging at your lips. Kim Seokjin just turned down an offer to go to bed to stay out here and talk to you. Holy crap.

“You know,” you say, “you could have at least asked him for the passcode so you could get in later.”

At this realization, Jin’s eyes grow wide and then with a groan, he lets his head fall in defeat. “That would have been smart,” he utters but then looks up at you again. “Will you keep me company?”

You’ve had a long day of sightseeing and shopping and about ten minutes earlier, sleep sounded like the best thing in the world. But now…there’s nowhere else you’d rather be. You can sleep when you’re dead. “Of course I will,” you finally say with a smile.

Jin returns the grin and rests his elbows on his knees as he looks out at the water and moon shining above it. The two of you are silent for a while as you soak up the scenery. At last, he turns to you again.

“So, Y/N,” he says. “Do you know BTS?”

You feel relief flood your body as you begin to nervously laugh with him.

“Jin-hyung?”

The two of you turn to find Park Jimin propping the door open, rubbing his eyes sleepily. A Chimmy sleeping mask is pushed up on his forehead making his hair stick out every which way.

“Our director called and asked me to come down and let you in.” With one eye still closed, he sets the other one on you. “Oh. Hello,” he cracks.

You practically choke as you give a small wave back at your bias wrecker. Even half-asleep and bedraggled he looks perfect.

“Uh…thanks, Jimin,” Jin says and glances at you. “I think I’m okay, though.”

Jimin’s forehead creases as he furrows his brow and sticks out his lips in a confused pout. “Really?”

“Yeah, go back to bed.”

With a sleepy moan, the maknae shuffles back inside, pulling the door closed behind him, essentially locking the older one out…again.

You turn to look at him, a smile tugging at your lips. Kim Seokjin just turned down an offer to go to bed to stay out here and talk to you. Holy crap.

“You know,” you say, “you could have at least asked him for the passcode so you could get in later.”

At this realization, Jin’s eyes grow wide and then with a groan, he lets his head fall in defeat. “That would have been smart,” he utters but then looks up at you again. “Will you keep me company?”

You’ve had a long day of sightseeing and shopping and about ten minutes earlier, sleep sounded like the best thing in the world. But now…there’s nowhere else you’d rather be. You can sleep when you’re dead. “Of course I will,” you finally say with a smile.

Jin returns the grin and rests his elbows on his knees as he looks out at the water and moon shining above it. The two of you are silent for a while as you soak up the scenery. At last, he turns to you again.

“So, Y/N,” he says. “Do you know BTS?”
trail.content_abstract:
BTS au one-shot

Jin x Reader Y/N

Fluff

Word Count: 1,078

A/N: Because this situation was too funny not to write about.

You watch from where you stand on the street as a man, face shadowed by the brim of his black snapback, stands on the porch to his house, pleading with a camera crew. The whole situation is intriguing and you find yourself inching closer to try and hear what’s going on.

“I forgot the passcode,” he slurs—ah, he speaks Korean!—and cocks his head to the side. “Please tell me the passcode.”

None of the camera crew respond, keeping their equipment trained on him. He lets out a sigh and his head falls back so he’s looking at the night sky. “Please help me,” he whines.

“You’ve forgotten the passcode to get into your house,” one of the crew finally says. “And you failed to bring your key with you when you decided to go out drinking. You can enter again only if one of the other members comes out.”

BTS Witchcraft: Park Jimin

↳ Crystal Witch

These witches primarily work with stones, gems, crystals, and rocks. They love geology, spend a lot of time hiking and collecting crystals. Usually very organized individuals that are in tune with the earth.

Meet the Coven:
 Jin ~ Suga ~ J-Hope ~ RM ~ Jimin ~ V ~ Jungkook
